DataElement.preferredName: SNP Info Minor Allele Nucleotide Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Single Nucleotide Polymorphism; provides access to the clones and the trace files from which it was identified, the two most common substitutions at that position, the offset of the SNP in the parent sequence, and a confidence score (NCICB)_Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.:one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product._A subunit of DNA or RNA consisting of a nitrogenous base (adenine, guanine, thymine, or cytosine in DNA; adenine, guanine, uracil, or cytosine in RNA), a phosphate molecule, and a sugar molecule (deoxyribose in DNA and ribose in RNA). (http://biotech.icmb.utexas.edu).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Single Nucleotide Polymorphism; provides access to the clones and the trace files from which it was identified, the two most common substitutions at that position, the offset of the SNP in the parent sequence, and a confidence score (NCICB)_Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.:one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Single Nucleotide Polymorphism; provides access to the clones and the trace files from which it was identified, the two most common substitutions at that position, the offset of the SNP in the parent sequence, and a confidence score (NCICB)

Concepts.definition: Provides access to the clones and the trace files from which it was identified, the two most common substitutions at that position, the offset of the SNP in the parent sequence, and a confidence score.

Property.preferredDefinition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.:one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.

Concepts.definition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subunit of DNA or RNA consisting of a nitrogenous base (adenine, guanine, thymine, or cytosine in DNA; adenine, guanine, uracil, or cytosine in RNA), a phosphate molecule, and a sugar molecule (deoxyribose in DNA and ribose in RNA). (http://biotech.icmb.utexas.edu).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleoside that is composed of adenine and d-ribose. Adenosine or adenosine derivatives play many important biological roles in addition to being components of DNA and RNA. Adenosine itself is a neurotransmitter. (MeSH)

Concepts.definition: A ribonucleoside comprised of adenine bound to ribose, with vasodilatory, antiarrhythmic and analgesic activities. Phosphorylated forms of adenosine play roles in cellular energy transfer, signal transduction and the synthesis of RNA.

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
